passage_text: House Rabbit Society volunteers get countless calls from well-meaning people who find orphans or abandoned baby rabbits behind the shed or in a nearby field. Unknowingly they break up families and separate mother rabbits from their babies in an effort to save them.

Rabbits return to feed their young only once or twice a day for a few minutes, usually at night. Just because the babies have been by themselves for 5 minutes does not mean that they have been abandoned. The mother is typically gone from the nest to eat and draw attention away from the nest.
